author: Special Correspondent
text:
Collector N. Subbiyan explaining the features of Voter Verified Paper Audit Trail to all party members in Tjhanjavur on Thursday.— PHOTO: DIPR

The Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) system, wherein a voter will be able to see a printout of the symbol of the candidate to whom he has voted, will be introduced in the Thanjavur constituency in the district for the first time in the Assembly election.

Special VVPAT machines will be used in all polling stations of the constituency. The printout of the image, which could be viewed through a glass window, would be retained in the VVPAT unit.

District Collector N. Subbaiyan inspected the checking of the VVPAT devices that are to be used in the constituency in the presence of representatives of political parties here on Thursday.

It was during the by-election to the Noksen Assembly constituency of Nagaland in September 2013 that the VVPAT was launched in the country. VVPAT machines are to be used in 17 constituencies during the Assembly election in the State.

Mr. Subbaiyan told presspersons that electronic voting machines which were to be used in the eight Assembly constituencies in the district had arrived. They had been checked and kept in safe custody.

Awareness programmes under the Systematic Voters Education and Electoral Participation (SVEEP) programme had been taken up across the district to achieve cent per cent polling, he said.
title: Voter verifiable audit to be introduced in Thanjavur
